intro: Monanthocitrus bispinosa, commonly known as the two-spined citrus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes other citrus species. The plant is characterized by its spiny leaves and fragrant white flowers. Its fruit, though not commonly consumed, has been used in traditional medicine. The botanical features of M. bispinosa make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
